Package edu.ncsu.csc216.service_wolf.model.incident

Class Incident

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.ncsu.csc216.service_wolf.model.incident.Incident
  • public class Incident
extends java.lang.Object
    A class that represents an incident that is Mannaged under serviceWolfManager. An incident can have 5 Incidet states which are, New, In progress, on HOld, Canceled and resolved. this states take is Commands like ASSIGN, RESOLVE, REOPEN, CANCEL, INVESTIGATW and ONHOLD to navigate through the FSM state.
    Author:
    Meles Meles

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class Description
      class  Incident.CanceledState
      A class that represents a cancled incident of the service wolf and implemented in the Interface Incident State
      class  Incident.InProgressState
      A class that represents an InProgress incident of the service wolf.
      class  Incident.NewState
      A class that represents a New incident of the service wolf and implemented New state is the Begining of the Incident FSM system.
      class  Incident.OnHoldState
      A class that represents a OnHold incident of the service wolf and implemented.
      class  Incident.ResolvedState
      A class that represents a Resolved incident of the service wolf in the FSM system.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Incident

        public Incident​(java.lang.String title,
                java.lang.String caller,
                java.lang.String message)
        Constructs a Incident from the provided title, caller, and message.The incident id field is set to the value stored in the incident counter. The counter is then incremented using the inceidnt increment counter. A new incident starts in a NEW state and the owner is set to UNOWNED and the status dewtails are set to no status and lstl;y the message is added in the incident log. *
        Parameters:
        title - The title of the incident
        caller - the name of the incident caller
        message - the message of the incident
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If any of the given parameters are null or empty string.

      • Incident

        public Incident​(int id,
                java.lang.String state,
                java.lang.String title,
                java.lang.String caller,
                int reopenCount,
                java.lang.String owner,
                java.lang.String statusDetails,
                java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> incidentLog)
        Constructs a Incident from the provided title, caller, and message.The incident id field is set to the value stored in the incident counter. The counter is then incremented using the inceidnt increment counter. A new incident starts in a NEW state and the owner is set to UNOWNED and the status dewtails are set to no status and lstl;y the message is added in the incident log.
        Parameters:
        id - incidents unique id
        state - incidents state(inprogress, cancled, onhold, new, cancled)
        title - The title of the incident
        caller - caller the name of the incident caller
        reopenCount - the nummber of times the incident is opened
        owner - the owner and responsible for resolving the incident
        statusDetails - incidents status details
        incidentLog - of incident

        Parameters:
